intro: Randia edulis, commonly known as the red rice grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Randia edulis is adapted to thrive in moist, sunny environments and is sometimes found in disturbed soils.
